snippet: Apple faced another labor related class-action suit, while the City of New York tries to close the book on the Police Department’s stop-and-frisk program.
abstract: Editorial Keeping Track column notes that Apple faces another labor related class-action suit filed by current and former employees who say company failed to give timely rest and meal breaks; observes that New York City has tried to withdraw its appeal of federal court ruling declaring its stop-and-frisk tactics unconstitutional, but withdrawal has been opposed by police sergeants' union.
lead_paragraph: Apple faced another labor related class-action suit, while the City of New York tries to close the book on the Police Department’s stop-and-frisk program.

headline.main: Keeping Track: Another Labor Suit for Apple, Stop-and-Frisk
